model
Interface Gameboard

All Known Implementing Classes:
GameboardImp
public interface Gameboard

An interface for the gameboard model for the TTT system. Keeps track of the board and what pieces are where

Version:
1.0
Author:
Benjamin Pellittieri and Christopher Pauliks for Mustache Cash Stash

Method Summary
 PlaceValue[][] getBoard()
          Returns a copy of the underlying array implementation of the GameBoard
 GameResult getResult()
          Returns the current status of the game as an enum value
 Gameboard getState()
          Returns an immutable copy of this Gameboard for use by views to update their model.
 boolean osTurn()
          Returns whether it is O player's turn to place a piece.
 boolean requestMove(int xPosition, int yPosition, PlaceValue pieceToPlace)
          A request from a client to place a piece on the Gameboard at a certain position.
 boolean resign(PlaceValue pieceResigning)
          A request from a client to resign from the game.
 boolean xsTurn()
          Returns whether it is X player's turn to place a piece.
 

Method Detail

getState

Gameboard getState()
Returns an immutable copy of this Gameboard for use by views to update their model.

Returns:
An immutable copy of this Gameboard

xsTurn

boolean xsTurn()
Returns whether it is X player's turn to place a piece.

Returns:
true if it is X's turn, else false

osTurn

boolean osTurn()
Returns whether it is O player's turn to place a piece.

Returns:
true if it is O's turn, else false

getBoard

PlaceValue[][] getBoard()
Returns a copy of the underlying array implementation of the GameBoard

Returns:
A copy the array implementation of the GameBoard

getResult

GameResult getResult()
Returns the current status of the game as an enum value

Returns:
the current status of the game.

requestMove

boolean requestMove(int xPosition,
                    int yPosition,
                    PlaceValue pieceToPlace)
A request from a client to place a piece on the Gameboard at a certain position. The Gameboard should check whether the move is in turn and is valid before placing the piece.

Parameters:
xPosition - The x (horizontal) coordinate of the requested space to occupy
yPosition - The y (vertical) coordinate of the requested space to occupy
pieceToPlace - The type of piece to put in the requested location.
Returns:
Whether the move request was successful in updating the Gameboard.

resign

boolean resign(PlaceValue pieceResigning)
A request from a client to resign from the game. The GameBoard should check that the

Parameters:
pieceResigning - The piece value of the player resigning.
Returns:
Whether the resignation request was successfull in updating the Gameboard
